description.p: Not much is known about this race of small, catlike humanoids. Supposedly they hail from the far north, but even that information has been vagued by obscurity.
Most f'aeli are born with an innate affinity for magic. Be it library-dwelling scholars or swird-swinging warriors, magic always intertwines their goals and everyday lives.
Your f'aeles character has certain characteristics in common with all other f'aeli.

Ability Score Increase.Your Dexterity score increases by 1, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Age.F'aeli reach physical maturity around age 10 to 15, but can live to be over a thousand years old.
Alignment.F'aeli typically care about their own place in the world most of all, tending towards neutral alignments.
Size.F'aeli are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.
Speed.Despite your small stature, you are surprisingly quick on your feet. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Darkvision.Your catlike heritage and life in the dark north grants you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cannot discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Perceptive Focus.As an action, you can begin focusing entirely on one of your senses: sight, hearing or smell. Each minute spent focusing on that sense with this trait grants you a +1 bonus to relevant Perception check (up to a maximum of +10). Anytime while focusing, you may use your action to perform a Perception check using only the relevant sense. During this time, you cannot move or perform any other actions, and you have disadvantage on saving throws and Perception checks that don't use the relevant sense.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Common and F'aelian. The F'aelian language has mostly been lost to time, and is only practiced by a select few scholars and librarians.
Subrace.Two subraces of f'aeli exist, pureblood and feralborn. Choose one of these subraces.

description.p: Two subraces of f'aeli exist, pureblood and feralborn. Choose one of these subraces.
A pureblood f'aeles has origins in pure f'aelian society - their magical heritage is untainted and they show great promise in the arts of wizardry.

Ability Score Increase.Your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Magical Heritage.You know the Prestidigitation cantrip. Additionally, you can cast the Detect Magic spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.
Mastery Over MagicWhenever you deal any type of damage, you may choose to change it into any other type of damage, and it becomes magical damage if it wasn't already. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your highest ability modifier. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain all expended uses.

description.p: Feralborn f'aeli were brought into the world with an uncommon f'aeles birth defect that prevents them from using or storing any sort of magic. They have more catlike features, including a thin layer or fur that covers their body. NOTE: This type of f'aeles is incapable of casting spells! Do not take any classes that are capable of casting spells!

Ability Score Increase.Your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Devoid of Magic.Your body is incapable of allowing magic to flow through it. You cannot make use of any Spellcasting features and cannot cast spells or create spell effects from any sources. Attuning to magic items takes you an uninterrupted long rest, and you can only be attuned to one magic item at a time. You cannot be a willing target of any spell or magical effect, and you have advantage on saving throws against all hostile spells and other hostile magical effects.
